reg:regulation.reg:title: Columbia-Shuswap Regional District Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 189/2008, June 27, 2008]

bcl:section.bcl:text: The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to operate an Enhanced 9-1-1 Emergency Response System as an extended service.
The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to provide Economic Development Contribution as an extended service.
The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to provide Emergency Programs as an extended service under the Emergency Program Act.

The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to provide flood protection, including without limitation the powers of a district municipality under sections 552 and 599 of the Municipal Act1,2, as a local service.
The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to operate and maintain the Salmon Arm Airport as an extended service.
The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to provide Transit as a local service.
The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to contribute financial aid toward the cost of operation of the Golden Airport, as an extended service.
The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to contribute financial aid toward the cost of the Golden Cemetery, as an extended service.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Agreement to form part of regional library district
bcl:section.bcl:text: The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power of a municipality to enter into an agreement with the board of management of a library district to form part of a regional library district under Part 4 of the Library Act, as a local service.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Removal of dangerous buildings and other structures
bcl:section.bcl:text: The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to exercise the powers conferred on the council of a municipality under section 727 of the Local Government Act.
The Columbia-Shuswap Regional District is granted the additional power to, by bylaw, regulate, prohibit and impose requirements in relation to the use of firecrackers and fireworks.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Local Government Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 323, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 799 (1) (a)]
